description: From Latin historicus (“historical”), from Ancient Greek ἱστορικός (historikós, “exact; historical”). Cognate with French historique.

adjectives.description: historic (comparative more historic, superlative most historic)

entries.meaning: Very important; noteworthy: having importance or significance in history.
examples: July 4, 1776, is a historic date. A great deal of historical research has been done on the events leading up to that day.
The historical works of Lord Macaulay and Edward Gibbon are in and of themselves historic.
Sights are thick sown in the counties of York and Nottingham: the former is more historic.

entries.meaning: (now uncommon) Synonym of historical: of, concerning, or in accordance with recorded history or the past generally (See usage notes.)
(grammar) Various grammatical tenses and moods specially used in retelling past events.
examples: The historic tenses include the imperfect, the pluperfect, and the future perfect.

entries.meaning: (obsolete) A history, a non-fiction account of the past.
